channel.title: Comments on: OPENROWSET And Excel Problems
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.description: I was able to solve this problem with the advice from Paul P Clement in <a href="http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/adodotnetdataproviders/thread/d5b29496-d6a1-4ecf-b1a4-5550d80b84b6">this thread</a> I now have both versions of OleDB installed.
item.content:encoded: I was able to solve this problem with the advice from Paul P Clement in this thread I now have both versions of OleDB installed.

item.title: By: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.dc:creator: Naomi Nosonovsky
item.content:encoded:
I have office 2010 64 bit installed. I re-installed today http://www.microsoft.com/download/en/details.aspx?id=13255 but I still don’t see 32 bit version of OleDB 12.0 driver. Do you know where can I get it?

Thanks in advance.

item.title: By: Real Drouin
item.dc:creator: Real Drouin
item.content:encoded:
it’s all working fine for me but I need an extra thing

I need to change the header and the footer that show up on the document.

I need to show “invoice for “…. and the invoice number

How can I access the header and the footer

item.title: By: Bill
item.dc:creator: Bill
item.content:encoded:
Nice article! One more situation I haven’t been able to resolve:

OLEDB connection to Excel to the same file on the server works fine for weeks, then all of the sudden returns

OLE DB error trace [OLE/DB Provider ‘Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0’ IDBInitialize::Initialize returned 0x80004005: The provider did not give any information about the error.].
Msg 7399, Level 16, State 1, Line 1
OLE DB provider ‘Microsoft.Jet.OLEDB.4.0’ reported an error. The provider did not give any information about the error.

The file is not open anywhere, the file, path, etc. all exist as they always have.

The only solution I’ve found is to reboot the server. Then the Excel connection works again, for weeks… I suspect that restarting the SQL services would have the same effect. By the way, I’m using SQL 2000. Has anyone else run into this?
